pr_title: HDFS-15551. Tiny Improve for DeadNode detector

timeline.message:
DeadNode detector's tiny improve

1. add or improve some logs for adding local & global deadnodes
2. logic improve
3. fix typo

timeline.bodyText:
1、Is it necessary to add log in Local dead nodes?
2、if add debug log in DFSInputStream#addToLocalDeadNodes, do you need add log in DFSInputStream#removeFromLocalDeadNodes?
timeline.author: leosunli

replies.bodyText:
From the statistics of the production environment, the log output of local deadnode information is too few, so that it is troublesome to find the problem reason
The reason to use the DEBUG log level is to separate from the INFO log level of the detector, and the impact is small.
Remove logs can be added at the same time(I think both are OK). It was not added before considering that the local dead node removal method will almost never be called, unless the detector is turned on and there is already log output there.
replies.author: imbajin

timeline.bodyText: One case: when a lot of stale relicas, will the log flood?
timeline.author: leosunli

timeline.bodyText:
when a lot of stale relicas,  it should have many supsect nodes  but not dead nodes.
These nodes all will print this log.
What is the purpose of printing this log?
The client can access normally the suspect node.
